snippet: The Russian government said Wednesday that it would not renew a hugely successful 20-year partnership with the United States to safeguard and dismantle nuclear and chemical weapons.
abstract: Russian government says it will not renew hugely successful 20-year partnership with the United States to safeguard and dismantle nuclear and chemical weapons in former Soviet Union when program expires in spring 2013; decision is potentially grave setback in already fraying relationship between the former cold war enemies.
lead_paragraph: The Russian government said Wednesday that it would not renew a hugely successful 20-year partnership with the United States to safeguard and dismantle nuclear and chemical weapons.

headline.seo: Russia Won’t Renew Pact With U.S. on Weapons
headline.main: Russia Won’t Renew Pact on Weapons With U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russia Won’t Renew Pact On Weapons With U.S.

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
